title: Definable real number
summary: Informally, a definable real number is a real number that can be uniquely specified by its description.  The description may be expressed as a construction or as a formula of a formal language. For example, the positive square root of 2, 2 {\displaystyle {\sqrt {2}}} , can be defined as the unique positive solution to the equation x 2 = 2 {\displaystyle x^{2}=2} , and it can be constructed with a compass and straightedge.
